div.p: Family background... Parents are from Jamaica so I think you’d class me as like the first generation British or whatever you want to say.
Background-wise I was brought up in a very, very strict background full of Jamaican culture, Rastafarian culture as well;
my mum she was a nurse before she had, I think it was after my brother, after me she gave that up to take care of her family
because she’s a mother of like 9... So that’s, you know, but she now does community work now as well, she goes back to like Social Working
and stuff now that the younger one is now 21. My dad he runs an information culture centre that gives advice about the religion and also
offers community support. You know brought up in an inner city area there was loads of kids doing all different bad stuff and wrong stuff
and I was around it but I was never scared of the repercussions, I was never scared of going to jail, I had friends who’d gone to jail,
cousins who’d gone to jail and back so I was never scared of that, what scared me the most was going back and knowing the repercussions
I’d get from my parents so I would say they were definitely the biggest influence on where I am now and my logical thinking as well
they same advice they gave me and I’ll give to my son and it’s the same way I sort of live my life, the outlook I have,
so yeah if it wasn’t for them it probably wouldn’t, they were like my parents and counsel at the same time without just being parents.
